info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 5:57AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Whiteside and southeastern Carroll Counties through 615 AM CDT... At 557 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Milledgeville, or 10 miles northwest of Sterling, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Whiteside and southeastern Carroll Counties, including the following locations... Carroll County Fairgrounds, Hitt and Penrose. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
